intro: Crotalaria taubertii, commonly known as the yellow rattle, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow, spurred flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands. It has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces cylindrical seed pods that split open to release its seeds. Crotalaria taubertii is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it beneficial for soil enrichment.
